medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Condition started this morning at 10 AM with mild epigastric pain, which worsened and shifted to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) area. The pain is now sharp, worsens with movement or palpation, and has been associated with chills but no fever, nausea/vomiting, shortness of breath, chest pain, or anorexia. There is scant bright red blood noted in the setting of known prior hemorrhoids.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Attention deficit disorder, septal deviation, right wrist fracture surgery.
